name: HorseInventory
description: The HorseInventory class provides functionality for interacting with horse inventory screens in Minecraft.
overview:
This includes managing saddles, armor, and chest inventories for horses, donkeys, mules, and similar equine mobs. It extends the base Inventory class and adds horse-specific functionality while inheriting all standard inventory operations.

This class is automatically created when you open a horse inventory screen and can be accessed through Player.getInventory() or Inventory.create() when a horse inventory is open.

Supported Horse Types:
- Horses (Saddles, Armor)
- Donkeys (Saddles, Chests)
- Mules (Saddles, Chests)
- Llamas (Chests, Decoration)
- Other AbstractHorseEntity subclasses

constructors.description: Creates a new HorseInventory instance for the specified horse inventory screen. This constructor is primarily used internally by JSMacros.

methods.name: canBeSaddled
methods.description: Checks if the current horse entity is capable of being saddled.

methods.name: isSaddled
methods.description: Checks if the horse currently has a saddle equipped.

methods.name: getSaddle
methods.description: Retrieves the item stack currently in the saddle slot.

methods.name: hasArmorSlot
methods.description: Checks if the horse entity has a slot available for horse armor.

methods.name: getArmor
methods.description: Retrieves the item stack currently in the armor slot.

methods.name: hasChest
methods.description: Checks if the horse entity is equipped with a chest (e.g., Donkeys, Mules, Llamas).

methods.name: getInventorySize
methods.description: Gets the total size (number of slots) of the horse's chest inventory.

methods.name: getHorseInventory
methods.description: Retrieves a list of all items currently stored in the horse's chest inventory.

methods.name: getHorse
methods.description: Gets the helper object for the specific horse entity associated with this inventory, providing access to stats like speed and jump strength.
